meanings.definition: A sudden strong and unreflective urge or desire.
meanings.sent1: Her impulses led her to buy the colorful dress without thinking twice.
meanings.sent2: He followed his impulses and jumped into the pool without checking the water first.
meanings.sent3: His impulses to eat all the cookies in one go made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The impulses to explore the unknown drove her to travel the world.
meanings.sent5: The impulses to help others made him a beloved member of the community.

meanings.sent1: The music provided the impulses for the dancers to move energetically.
meanings.sent2: The fear of failure acted as strong impulses for him to study harder.
meanings.sent3: The impulses of competition pushed them to train even harder.
meanings.sent4: The love for his family served as the impulses for him to work tirelessly.
meanings.sent5: The impulses of curiosity led her to discover new interests.

meanings.definition: A wave of electrical excitation passing along a nerve fiber or muscle cell.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how impulses travel through the nerves to control movement.
meanings.sent2: The impulses from the brain signal the muscles to contract during exercise.
meanings.sent3: The impulses in the body are like messages sent by tiny messengers.
meanings.sent4: The impulses racing through the nerves are like lightning bolts of communication.
meanings.sent5: The impulses firing in the brain create the symphony of our bodily functions.
